name: Hotel Palacio de Los Navas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Mostly plus points, but a couple of negatives

reviews.text: Great location: easy walking distance of the city centre and numerous bars, restaurants and shops. Having read some comments about safety issues (and previously having been mugged in Barcelona), we always felt safe walking around this area. You can easily get a bus up to the the other areas (or walk if you have the energy).
reviews.title: Good location, pretty hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was reasonably sized (we had a superior room on the first floor). It was very clean and tidy and had a good shower.
reviews.title: delightful hotel

likes.disliked: — some street noise, but no inter-room noise

reviews.title: Friendly staff, nightmare parking lot
reviews.text: The location of the Palacio de Los Navas is great and the young staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Although the room was a bit small, it was not uncomfortable and everything worked including the all-important AC. The Palacio is located in a busy area but I always travel with earplugs ("Hearos" are my favorite brand) and I slept well even though I am not generally a "good sleeper."
As is typical in a Spanish hotel, the rooms are located around a very attractive courtyard/lobby with comfy furniture and books.
reviews.title: nice hotel - friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the scary part: the parking lot was hellish: steep descent, ridiculously tight spaces which show evidence of many prior accidents. It took almost an hour of turning, clutching and jockeying to get the car parked. I would recommend NOT using this parking lot which the hotel sent us to.
reviews.title: tiny room, very loud street noise

reviews.text: stayed for two nights in June
reviews.title: very good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A Great Surprise

description: This new small hotel in the city centrethe was originally a Palace in the 16th century. It has been skilfully restored; retaining most of its original architectural features, and is now a delightful nineteen room inn. The rooms are beautifully decorated, all ensuited, with air conditioning, minibar, satellite television, safe, internet access and hairdryer and anti-fog mirrors in bathrooms. They surround a central, typically Granadian columned patio/courtyard. There are standard or superior double rooms, a junior suite and a lovely superior deluxe.
